result.execSummary:
The defendant Sachel F Hamm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sachel F Hamm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sachel F Hamm was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
State has filed order and defense to notify court in 30 days if hearing is needed.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion in probation and restitution is paid in full in this case.
DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
